title: geth sending incorrect work via RPC
body:
From what I can tell, `geth` is sending incorrect work to via the RPC, when using the latest `develop` at the time of this writing, and sending work to `ethminer`. Here's my `ethminer` output that would suggest incorrect work being passed (check out the zeroed header hash, seed hash, and target). I've included `geth` output below as well:

Forgive me if this is a cpp-ethereum issue. Will move there if so.

**ethminer output**


If you're referring to the very first grab, yep, that seems incorrect. Any sequential calls seem to work fine

@obscuren Definitely. That seems to happen repeatedly though (even though not shown in the logs above). After more investigation, it seems to be related to geth restarting the mining operation regularly:

```
I0520 11:12:42.004709    5373 miner.go:51] Mining operation aborted due to sync operation
I0520 11:12:42.960408    5373 miner.go:91] Starting mining operation (CPU=0 TOT=1)
```

I was stumped why I was getting that log output for awhile, however, it cleared up after I restarted the virtual machine that geth was running on. Once that output cleared up, so did the bad grabs.
Okay. I'll look in to this. Thanks :)
@tcoulter did this ever happen again for Frontier?
@fjl Not that I've seen (I no longer watch the output as much). Ever since things have run smoothly.
